heading: wiggling into long distance
subheading: baby bells are largely restricted to the local market, but us west found a way to expand its horizons: an alliance with qwest.
author: reuters
text: denver -- qwest the companies said in a joint press release that the alliance will allow customers to call either company to order a service package that includes local phone services from us west and long-distance services from qwest. customers selecting the plan will receive a flat long-distance rate of 10 cents per minute around the clock, seven days a week. the pact also combines their billing services for the plan, the companies said. the service will be available in all 14 western states that us west serves.the wall street journal
